page.title: 17Foliejon Park.
page.content: This{Park}obviously has a very long history since it was mentioned in the Domesday Book.The present large,white {mansion}was built in the late 18th century.It stands on a hill with views over its{500 acres}of farmland and the surrounding countryside.During World War II the exiled king of Norway and his family lived at Foliejon.Private ownership of the Park ended in 1957 when it was bought by{Mining and {Chemical Products}Ltd.Research is done in the old stable block but the house itself is still a residence.The Managing Director and his family lived there and many foreign visitors were entertained there.Before his death in 1966 he and his wife redecorated and refurnished the house and now it is preserved because of its{architectural {importance.}He also planted many rare trees in the grounds.
